Study Title: Safety and Efficacy Study of mFOLFOX-6 Plus Cetuximab for 8 Cycles Followed by mFOLFOX-6 Plus Cetuximab or Single Agent Cetuximab as Maintenance Therapy in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer and WT KRAS Tumours
Brief Summary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the combination of mFOLFOX-6 plus cetuximab for 8 cycles followed by mFOLFOX-6 plus cetuximab or single agent (s/a) cetuximab as maintenance therapy in patients (pts) with metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC).
Interventions: DRUG: mFOLFOX-6 + cetuximab until disease progression or early withdrawal.|DRUG: 8 cycles of mFOLFOX-6 + cetuximab, followed by cetuximab alone until disease progression or early withdrawal.
Secondary Outcome Measures: overall survival, 2010-2014|rate of objective responses, 2010-2014|disease's resectability (R0), 2010-2014|evaluate hypomagnesaemia as a predictive factor in the treatment's efficacy, 2010-2014|Adverse events, 2010-2014
Sponsor: Spanish Cooperative Group for the Treatment of Digestive Tumours (TTD)
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: Spanish Cooperative Group for Gastrointestinal Tumour Therapy, Madrid, 28046, Spain
